thread.title: Thousands of Passengers Stranded by American Airlines with 71 Flights Cancelled and 1253 Delays Led to Travel Disrupted in Routes Including Mexico, Canada, Germany, UK, Dallas, Miami, and Philadelphia US - Travel And Tour World
thread.title_full: Thousands of Passengers Stranded by American Airlines with 71 Flights Cancelled and 1253 Delays Led to Travel Disrupted in Routes Including Mexico, Canada, Germany, UK, Dallas, Miami, and Philadelphia US - Travel And Tour World

title: Thousands of Passengers Stranded by American Airlines with 71 Flights Cancelled and 1253 Delays Led to Travel Disrupted in Routes Including Mexico, Canada, Germany, UK, Dallas, Miami, and Philadelphia US - Travel And Tour World
text:
American Airlines faced significant operational disruptions on September 24, 2025 , due to a technical issue that affected flights across the U.S. and international routes. The disruption led to 71 cancellations and 1253 delays , leaving thousands of passengers stranded and impacting multiple destinations, including Mexico , Canada , Germany , the UK , and major U.S. hubs such as Dallas , Miami , and Philadelphia . Several American Airlines flights were impacted by disruptions at various airports. Flight AA728 from Philadelphia International Airport (PHL) to London Heathrow Airport (LHR) is en route with a scheduled departure at 10:30 PM EDT and an estimated arrival at 10:19 AM BST (+1) . Similarly, AA715 from Venice Marco Polo Airport (VCE) to Philadelphia International Airport (PHL) is en route, departing at 11:59 AM CEST and expected to arrive at 2:31 PM EDT . AA781 from Naples International Airport (NAP) to Philadelphia International Airport (PHL) also remains en route with a scheduled departure at 11:53 AM CEST and an arrival at 3:22 PM EDT . AA747 , flying from Nice Côte d’Azur Airport (NCE) to Philadelphia International Airport (PHL) , is en route, scheduled to depart at 12:53 PM CEST and arriving at 3:30 PM EDT . AA110 , flying from Chicago O’Hare International Airport (ORD) to Leonardo da Vinci International Airport (FCO) in Rome, is en route, with a scheduled departure at 4:46 PM CDT and an arrival at 8:49 AM CEST (+1) . AA4338 from Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) to Tucson International Airport (TUS) departed at 10:25 AM CDT and is en route to arrive at 11:25 AM MDT . Finally, AA240 from New York John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK) to London Heathrow Airport (LHR) is scheduled to depart at 11:05 PM EDT , with an expected arrival at 11:30 AM BST (+1) . These details are available for tracking via the FlightAware link for each flight.
Technical Issue Overview
Action Taken : No cancellations were initially reported, and alternative procedures were used to close flights. However, significant delays were still experienced by passengers. Advertisement
Problem Identified : American Airlines reported a technical issue that impacted their maintenance applications.
Impact : The issue led to delays in flight departures , with crews working to resolve the problem. Total Delays : 1253 flights experienced delays, significantly affecting travel in Dallas , Miami , Philadelphia , and international locations.

AAL1486 Aircraft Type : B738 Origin : Charlotte/Douglas Intl (KCLT) Destination : Buffalo Niagara Intl (KBUF) Scheduled Departure : 04:15 PM EDT Major Airports Affected Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) : 405 flights delayed 38 cancellations Miami International Airport (MIA) : Significant delays due to the technical issue. Philadelphia International Airport (PHL) : Delays impacted both domestic and international flights. Passenger Experience Frustration : Many passengers expressed frustration on social media, reporting being kept on the tarmac for over two hours. Apologies from American Airlines : The airline acknowledged the inconvenience and assured passengers that teams were working to resolve the issue. Rebooking : American Airlines provided rebooking options and encouraged travelers to check flight statuses for the latest updates. Advertisement
